## A clinically validated program
We set you up with everything you need to eat well easily.

## FAQs
[Visit our help center](https://usenourish.com/</faq>)
What is Nourish?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
At Nourish, we help people like you find affordable nutrition care that works with their insurance plan. Most of our patients pay $0 out-of-pocket and are fully covered. [Click here](https://usenourish.com/<https:/signup.usenourish.com/flow/get-started>) to book an appointment and get started on your health goals today.
What is a registered dietitian? Why should I see a dietitian?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
Registered Dietitian Nutritionists (RDNs) are health professionals specializing in food and nutrition. Dietitians provide a behavioral health approach to nutritional care to help you reach your long-term health goals. To learn more about our approach to care, click [here](https://usenourish.com/<https:/www.usenourish.com/our-approach-to-care>). 
Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) is a nationally recognized credential. At Nourish, all our dietitians are RDNs, which means that they have completed a Bachelor or Masterâ€™s degree in Nutrition, passed a national exam, and complete a number of ongoing continuing education credits annually.
Are dietitians the same thing as nutritionists?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
No, they are not the same. The title "nutritionist" is not a protected title, which means that anyone, including yourself, can call themselves a nutritionist. At Nourish, all our providers are Registered Dietitian Nutritionists (RDN) which is a legally protected title. Registered Dietitian Nutritionists must complete a Bachelor or Master's degree in Nutrition, pass a national exam, and complete a number of ongoing continuing education credits annually. [Read our blog post to learn more!](https://usenourish.com/<http:/www.usenourish.com/blog/dietitian-vs-nutritionist>)
With Nourish, you can be sure that you are speaking with licensed health professionals that have been trained in nutrition and dietary intervention. To learn more about our approach to care, please click [here](https://usenourish.com/<https:/www.usenourish.com/our-approach-to-care>).
How many appointments will I need? 
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
We have a very individualized approach depending upon your current diet, your goals and the number and severity of the health issues you face. Ideally, we like to work with you weekly, bi-monthly, or monthly, depending upon your needs. This approach provides an opportunity to work with you during various eating situations throughout all the seasons of the year (holidays, vacations, barbecues, etc.). Some clients need more intensive follow-up than others â€” it varies from client to client, but we will always work with you for to achieve your best outcome.
Do providers at Nourish work with children? 
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
Yes, at Nourish we have many dietitians who specialize in working with children. We have experience in dealing with nutrition issues related to children, including overweight/underweight, diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, food allergies, and eating disorders.
Will my insurance cover my sessions?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
Nourish is currently in-network with 6 major insurance companies: Blue Cross Blue Shield / Anthem, United Healthcare, Aetna, Cigna, Medical Mutual of Ohio, and Medicare.**‍**
**94% of in-network patients pay $0 out-of-pocket. Use our coverage calculator to verify your insurance coverage and learn more about how we work with your insurance company.** ‍
In some rare cases, there are costs associated with using insurance. The [Nourish Guarantee](https://usenourish.com/<https:/www.usenourish.com/#faqs-guarantee>) is our commitment to providing a no-surprise billing experience for you:
  * If your appointment gets denied, we won't charge you for any appointments that have already occurred. You get those appointments for free.
  * If your appointment has a copay or coinsurance, you will not be charged more than your initial estimate for any appointments youâ€™ve had until we learn your real cost. Once we learn your actual copay or coinsurance, you will be immediately notified over email. For future appointments thereafter, you will be charged the full copay or coinsurance amount.
  * If your appointment goes towards your deductible, we'll offer you two options for any appointments that already took place until that point:
    * You can either pay the deductible and keep doing appointments covered by insurance, or
    * You can choose to not pay it and we wonâ€™t charge you anything for appointments youâ€™ve had. For any future appointments, our out-of-pocket rate is $145.


Contact us today at support@usenourish.com if you have any other questions.

## FAQs
Visit our help centerâŸ¨83âŸ©
What is Nourish?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
At Nourish, we help people like you find affordable nutrition care that works with their insurance plan. Most of our patients pay $0 out-of-pocket and are fully covered. Click hereâŸ¨84âŸ© to book an appointment and get started on your health goals today.
What is a registered dietitian? Why should I see a dietitian?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
Registered Dietitian Nutritionists (RDNs) are health professionals specializing in food and nutrition. Dietitians provide a behavioral health approach to nutritional care to help you reach your long-term health goals. To learn more about our approach to care, click hereâŸ¨85âŸ©. 
Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) is a nationally recognized credential. At Nourish, all our dietitians are RDNs, which means that they have completed a Bachelor or Masterâ€™s degree in Nutrition, passed a national exam, and complete a number of ongoing continuing education credits annually.
Are dietitians the same thing as nutritionists?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
No, they are not the same. The title "nutritionist" is not a protected title, which means that anyone, including yourself, can call themselves a nutritionist. At Nourish, all our providers are Registered Dietitian Nutritionists (RDN) which is a legally protected title. Registered Dietitian Nutritionists must complete a Bachelor or Master's degree in Nutrition, pass a national exam, and complete a number of ongoing continuing education credits annually. Read our blog post to learn more!âŸ¨86âŸ©
With Nourish, you can be sure that you are speaking with licensed health professionals that have been trained in nutrition and dietary intervention. To learn more about our approach to care, please click hereâŸ¨85âŸ©.
How many appointments will I need? 
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
We have a very individualized approach depending upon your current diet, your goals and the number and severity of the health issues you face. Ideally, we like to work with you weekly, bi-monthly, or monthly, depending upon your needs. This approach provides an opportunity to work with you during various eating situations throughout all the seasons of the year (holidays, vacations, barbecues, etc.). Some clients need more intensive follow-up than others â€” it varies from client to client, but we will always work with you for to achieve your best outcome.
Do providers at Nourish work with children? 
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
Yes, at Nourish we have many dietitians who specialize in working with children. We have experience in dealing with nutrition issues related to children, including overweight/underweight, diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, food allergies, and eating disorders.
Will my insurance cover my sessions?
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/623de5fee0c46d3440a5ff42/650dec1efd884acf66f56ec2_add.svg)
Nourish is currently in-network with 6 major insurance companies: Blue Cross Blue Shield / Anthem, United Healthcare, Aetna, Cigna, Medical Mutual of Ohio, and Medicare.**‍**
**94% of in-network patients pay $0 out-of-pocket. Use our coverage calculator to verify your insurance coverage and learn more about how we work with your insurance company.** ‍
In some rare cases, there are costs associated with using insurance. The Nourish GuaranteeâŸ¨87âŸ© is our commitment to providing a no-surprise billing experience for you:

  * If your appointment has a copay or coinsurance, you will not be charged more than your initial estimate for any appointments youâ€™ve had until we learn your real cost. Once we learn your actual copay or coinsurance, you will be immediately notified over email. For future appointments thereafter, you will be charged the full copay or coinsurance amount.
  * If your appointment goes towards your deductible, we'll offer you two options for any appointments that already took place until that point:
    * You can either pay the deductible and keep doing appointments covered by insurance, or
    * You can choose to not pay it and we wonâ€™t charge you anything for appointments youâ€™ve had. For any future appointments, our out-of-pocket rate is $145.

Its mission is straightforward yet impactful: to address America's healthcare crisis by making nutrition accessible through telehealth dietitian services that are covered by insurance. This approach connects patients with chronic conditions to Registered Dietitians (RDs), enabling them to get the nutrition therapy they need without the burden of out-of-pocket expenses.

The company operates with a relatively compact but dedicated team of 38 employees, led by their group partner, Jared Friedman. Nourish touts an impressive statistic: approximately 94% of their patients pay $0 out of pocket for services, which speaks volumes about their commitment to a stress-free, transparent billing process. Theyâ€™re able to achieve this through partnerships with major insurance providers across all 50 states, making access to professional nutrition guidance as seamless as possible.

Nourish has built a user-friendly platform where clients can find dietitians, schedule appointments, and manage their health goalsâ€”all via a convenient mobile app. Patients undergo a comprehensive nutrition assessment in their first session, during which their dietitian evaluates their health goals to design a personalized care plan. Follow-ups include actionable coaching and progress tracking, ensuring support is available at every stage of the health journey.

The company emphasizes evidence-based care, resulting in tangible improvementsâ€”91% of patients report overall health improvements, and 82% meet their primary health goals. They're not just about nutritional advice; Nourish takes a holistic view of health, considering factors like sleep, exercise, and mental well-being. Their app also offers additional resources, including meal planning and curated content, further enriching the user experience.

As they aim to help millions embrace healthier lifestyles, Nourish's clear vision, innovative model, and commitment to service position them as a significant player in the consumer health space.
